sen.j: 長講堂領（ちょうこうどう-りょう）は、中世荘園公領制下における王家領荘園群の一つ。
sen.e: Chokodo-ryo was one of Imperial family's shoen (manor) under shoen koryo sei (the system of Public lands and Private estates) in the medieval period.
Chokodo-ryo was an Imperial family shoen (manor) under the shoen koryo sei (a system of Public lands and Private estates) during the medieval period.
Chokodo-ryo was an Imperial family shoen (manor) under the shoen koryo sei (a system of Public lands and Private estates) during the medieval period.

sen.j: 長講堂は後白河天皇の院御所である六条殿（ろくじょうどの）内に建立された持仏堂を起源とする、法華長講弥陀三昧堂（ほっけちょうこうみださんまいどう）の略称。
sen.e: Chokodo was the abbreviated name of Hokke Chodo Mida Sanmaido which originated from jibutsu-do hall (the nobility's private Buddha statue hall) and was constructed at Rokujodono, the Emperor Goshirakawa's in no gosho (the retired Emperor's court).

Chokodo is the abbreviation of "Hokke Chodo Mida Sanmaido," which originated from the jibutsu-do hall (the nobility's private Buddha statue hall) and constructed at Rokujodono, Emperor Goshirakawa's in no gosho (retired Emperor's court).

Chokodo is the abbreviation of "Hokke Choko Mida Sanmaido," which originated from the jibutsu-do hall (the nobility's private Buddha statue hall) and constructed at Rokujodono, Emperor Goshirakawa's in no gosho (retired Emperor's court).

sen.j: 後白河院は莫大な荘園を長講堂に寄進し長講堂領が確立する。
sen.e: Chokodo-ryo was established as the retired Emperor Goshirakawa donated vast numbers of shoen to Choko-do.
Chokodo-ryo was established after the retired Emperor Goshirakawa donated vast numbers of shoen to the Chokodo.
Chokodo-ryo was established after the retired Emperor Goshirakawa donated vast numbers of shoen to the Chokodo.

sen.j: 後白河院は長講堂とその所領を寵姫高階栄子所生の宣陽門院に譲った。
sen.e: The retired Emperor Goshirakawa handed over Chokodo as well as its territory to Senyomonin, who was born to the retired Emperor and his favorite concubine TAKASHINA no Eishi.
Retired Emperor Goshirakawa handed over the Chokodo and its territory to imperial princess Senyomonin, the daughter between himself and his favorite concubine TAKASHINA no Eishi.

sen.e: Retired Emperor Goshirakawa handed over the Chokodo and its territory to imperial princess Senyomonin, the daughter between himself and his favorite concubine TAKASHINA no Eishi.

sen.j: 42ヵ国89ヵ所に及ぶ長講堂の膨大な荘園は当初院政の財政基盤となった。
sen.e: Chokodo owned as many as 89 shoen in 42 provinces and initially these were the financial base of Insei (rule by the retird Emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Chokodo had eighty-nine shoen in fourty-two provinces that were initially the financial base of the Insei (rule by the retired Emperor).
The Chokodo had eighty-nine shoen in forty-two provinces that were initially the financial base of the Insei (rule by the retired Emperor).

sen.j: 承久の乱後は幕府の管理下に後深草天皇→伏見天皇→後伏見天皇→花園天皇→光厳天皇→崇光天皇→後小松天皇と持明院統に伝領された。
sen.e: After the Jokyu War, these shoen were successively inherited, under Bakufu's control, by the Emperors belonged to Jimyoin-to line; namely Emperor Gofukakusa - Emperor Gofushimi - Emperor Hanazono - Emperor Kogen - Emperor Suko -Emperor Gokomatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Jokyu War, under the control of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), these shoen were successively inherited by Emperors who belonged to the Jimyoin-to line, including Emperor Gofukakusa, Emperor Gofushimi, Emperor Hanazono, Emperor Kogen, Emperor Suko and Emperor Gokomatsu.
